cards.name: Alpha Rampage
cards.text:
**Rhinar Specialization** *(You may only have Alpha Rampage in your deck if your hero is Rhinar.)*

As an additional cost to play Alpha Rampage, discard a random card.

**Intimidate**

rulings.description:
The player who owns the banished card may look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.
You may target yourself with this ability. However you will receive the card back into your hand before drawing up to your hand size.
You may target a hero with no cards in hand.
If there are other banished cards that aren’t from intimidate, it is encouraged to keep intimidated cards seperate from these cards.

You may only play Alpha Rampage in your deck if your hero is Rhinar, Reckless Rampage or Rhinar (young hero).
You must have at least one other card in your hand to pay for the additional cost at the time you play Alpha Rampage.
The player who owns the banished face down card is allowed to look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.

cards.name: Arcanite Skullcap
cards.text: If you have less [life] than your opponent, Arcanite Skullcap gains +1[defense] and **Arcane Barrier 3.** *(If your hero would be dealt arcane damage, you may pay [3 resource] instead. If you do, prevent 3 arcane damage that source would deal.)*

rulings.description:
You can have multiple instances of arcane barrier, for example Nullrune Hood, Nullrune Cloak, and Nullrune Gloves.
Arcane barrier can be used every time you would be dealt arcane damage. It's not limited to once per turn.
Each instance of arcane barrier you control can be used 1 time only, each time a source would deal arcane damage to you. For example if a source would deal 5 arcane damage to you, and you control two cards with arcane barrier 1, you will in total be able to prevent 2 arcane damage this source would deal to you.
To fully prevent a card dealing 3 arcane damage, you would require 3 arcane barrier and 3 resources to prevent it. To fully prevent the arcane damage from 3 Runechant tokens (3 instances of 1 damage), you would require 1 arcane barrier and 3 resources to prevent it.
A equipment with arcane barrier does not move to the chain when arcane barrier is used.
You can prevent arcane damage you would deal to yourself.
Players cannot respond to the prevention. Arcane barrier is a replacement effect, not an activated or triggered ability.
You can only pay resources to arcane barrier if a source would deal arcane damage to you.
Preventing arcane damage does not destroy the equipment with arcane barrier (unless otherwise specified).

You may have multiple instances of arcane barrier.
You must pay [3 resource] to prevent arcane damage even if only one point of arcane damage would be prevented.
The prevention does not carry over even if you only prevent one arcane damage.
Arcanite Skullcap always has battleworn, even if you are on higher or lower [life] than your opponent.
Arcanite Skullcap gains the bonus if there is at least one opponent on less [life]. If there are multiple opponents on less {h}, arcanite skullcap still only gains the bonus once.
If your [life] becomes higher or lower after defending but before damage calculation, the value of [defense] will change accordingly.

cards.name: ARGH... Smash!
cards.text:
Roll a 6 sided die. Destroy up to X items where X is half the number, rounded down.

**Go again**

cards.name: Awakening Bellow
cards.text:
The next Brute attack action card you play this turn gains +1[attack].

**Intimidate** *(Target hero banishes face down a random card from their hand. At the beginning of the end phase, return all cards banished this way to their owner's hand.)*

**Go again**

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.

The player who owns the banished card may look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.
You may target yourself with this ability. However you will receive the card back into your hand before drawing up to your hand size.
You may target a hero with no cards in hand.
If there are other banished cards that aren’t from intimidate, it is encouraged to keep intimidated cards seperate from these cards.

cards.text:
Your next Brute attack this turn gains "If this attack is defended by less than 2 non-equipment cards, it gains +4[attack]."

**Intimidate** *(Target hero banishes face down a random card from their hand. At the beginning of the end phase, return all cards banished this way to their owner's hand.)*

**Go again**

**Go again**

cards.name: Barraging Big Horn
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Barraging Big Horn, discard a random card.

While Barraging Big Horn is defended by less than 2 non-equipment cards, it has **go again**.

cards.name: Beast Within
cards.text: If Beast Within is put into a graveyard from anywhere other than the combat chain, banish the top card of your deck and lose 1[life]. If it has 6 or more [attack], put it into your hand, otherwise repeat this process.

cards.name: Bloodrush Bellow
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Bloodrush Bellow, discard a random card.

Your Brute attacks gain +2[attack] this turn.

If the discarded card has 6 or more [attack], draw 2 cards and Bloodrush Bellow gains **go again**

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.

This checks the discarded card’s base power. Effects that modify a card's power are not applied to a card discarded from hand.
This card only affects Brute attacks (Brute attack action cards or Brute weapon attacks). Generic attack actions do not benefit this.

cards.name: Breakneck Battery
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Breakneck Battery, discard a random card.

If the discarded card has 6 or more [attack], Breakneck Battery gains **go again**.

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.

cards.name: Command and Conquer
cards.text:
Defense reactions can't be played to Command and Conquers chain link.

If Command and Conquer hits a hero, destroy all cards in their arsenal.

rulings.description:
The destroyed card is put into its owner’s graveyard.
Chain link is different from combat chain. If another attack is played after Command and Conquer in the same combat chain, defense reactions can be played on that attack.

cards.name: Energy Potion
cards.text: **Instant** - Destroy Energy Potion, gain [2 resource].
cards.flavour: Side effects may include agitation, confusion, aggression, tachycardia, fever and delirium.

rulings.description:
Energy Potion requires an action point to play as it is an action.
Energy Potion has sub-type Item, which means it stays in the arena until it is destroyed.
You may not defend with Energy Potion as it does not have a defense value.
You may use Energy Potion’s ability even when you are not spending any of the resources gained by it.
Energy Potion’s activated ability is an instant. You may activate it any time you have priority, including during an opponent’s turn, and during the reaction window of either player’s turn.

cards.name: Fyendal's Spring Tunic
cards.text:
At the start of your turn, if Fyendal's Spring Tunic has less than 3 energy counters, you may put an energy counter on it.

**Instant** - Remove 3 energy counters from Fyendal's Spring tunic: Gain [resource]

**Blade Break** (If you defend with Fyendal's Spring tunic, destroy it when the combat chain closes.)

rulings.description:
When you defend with a card it remains on the combat chain until the chain closes, therefore you cannot defend with an equipment multiple times on the same combat chain.
When this card is destroyed, it is sent to your graveyard.
The ability goes on the stack when the combat chain closes.

You cannot activate Fyendal’s Spring Tunic during the start of the turn phase (in response to the trigger), because players do not get priority during the start of turn phase.
You must have at least 3 energy counters on Fyendal’s Spring Tunic to use it’s activated ability.
Fyendal’s Spring Tunic’s activated ability is an instant. You may activate it any time you have priority, including during an opponent’s turn, and during the reaction window of either player’s turn.

cards.name: Gambler's Gloves
cards.text: Whenever a hero rolls a 6-sided die, you may destroy Gambler's Gloves. If you do, that hero rerolls the die. *(You decide whether to use Gambler's Glove after seeing the result of the die roll.)*

cards.name: Goliath Gauntlet
cards.text: **Action** - Destroy Goliath Gauntlet: The next attack action card with cost [2 resource] or greater you play this turn gains +2[attack]. **Go again**

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.
The attack action card does not gain go again. Goliath Gauntlet’s activated ability requires an action point to use and provides an action point from go again upon resolution.

cards.name: Last Ditch Effort
cards.text: When you play Last Ditch Effort, if you have no cards in your deck, it gains +4[attack] and **go again**.
cards.flavour: For creatures that feed on fear, the moment of death is a veritable feast.

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.

Last Ditch Effort checks how many cards are in your deck at the time you play it. If after you play it your deck’s size changes, the stats and go again applied to Last Ditch Effort would still remain.

cards.name: Massacre
cards.text:
If you have discarded a card with 6 or more [attack] this turn, Massacre gains +2[attack] and **intimidate**.

If Massacre is discarded to pay the cost of a Brute attack action card, **intimidate**.

You can only pay resources to arcane barrier if a source would deal arcane damage to you.
Preventing arcane damage does not destroy the equipment with arcane barrier (unless otherwise specified).

cards.name: Pack Hunt
cards.text: **Intimidate** *(Target hero banishes face down a random card from their hand. At the beginning of the end phase, return all cards banished this way to their owner's hand.
cards.flavour: Horrific beasts lurk within the shadows, their gaping maws dripping with blood.

rulings.description:
The player who owns the banished card may look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.
You may target yourself with this ability. However you will receive the card back into your hand before drawing up to your hand size.
You may target a hero with no cards in hand.
If there are other banished cards that aren’t from intimidate, it is encouraged to keep intimidated cards seperate from these cards.

cards.name: Primeval Bellow
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Primeval Bellow, discard a random card.

Your next brute attack this turn gains +5[attack].

**Go again**

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.

cards.name: Pummel

rulings.description:
You cannot play Pummel if there is not a legal target.
You cannot target a weapon, only a weapon attack.

cards.name: Reckless Swing
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Reckless Swing, discard a random card.

If the discarded card has 6 or more [attack], deal 2 damage to the attacking hero.

rulings.description:
You must have at least one other card in your hand to pay for the additional cost at the time you play Reckless Swing.
This checks the discarded card’s base power. Effects that modify a card's power are not applied to a card discarded from hand.
The damage cannot be blocked but it can be prevented by a prevention effect.
You can only pitch when there is a cost to pay. You cannot pitch a card to play Reckless Swing.

cards.name: Remembrance
cards.text:
Shufle up to 3 action cards from your graveyard into your deck.

Banish Remembrance.

rulings.description:
You may not defend with Remembrance as it does not have a defense value.
You may shuffle 0, 1, 2 or 3 action cards from your graveyard into your deck.
You are not required to announce your choices until the card resolves.
You may only shuffle action cards from your graveyard into your deck. This includes attack actions. This excludes any card that is not an action such as equipment, resource, defense reaction, attack reaction and instant.
Remembrance is an instant. You may play it anytime you have priority, including during an opponent’s turn, and during the reaction window of either player’s turn.

cards.name: Rhinar, Reckless Rampage
cards.text: When you discard a card with 6 or more [attack] during your action phase, *intimidate*.

rulings.description:
The player who owns the banished card may look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.
You may target yourself with this ability. However you will receive the card back into your hand before drawing up to your hand size.
You may target a hero with no cards in hand.
If there are other banished cards that aren’t from intimidate, it is encouraged to keep intimidated cards seperate from these cards.

This checks the discarded card’s base power. Effects that modify a card's power are not applied to a card discarded from hand.
The player who owns the card banished face down is allowed to look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.

cards.name: Riled Up
cards.text: If you have discarded a card with 6 or more [attack] this turn, Riled Up gains +1[attack].
cards.flavour: When word of war reached the Rek'vas Bloodboars, they were struck with fear... fear of missing out!

cards.name: Romping Club
cards.text:
**Once per turn Action** - [2 resource]: **Attack**

**Once per Turn Effect** - When you discard a card with 6 or more [attack], Romping Club gains +1[attack] until end of turn.

rulings.description: This checks the discarded card’s base power. Effects that modify a card's power are not applied to a card discarded from hand.

cards.name: Sand Sketched Plan
cards.text:
**Rhinar Specialization** *(You may only have Sand Sketched Plan in your deck if your hero is Rhinar.)*

Search your deck for a card, put it into your hand, discard a random card, then shuffle your deck.

If the discarded card has 6 or more [attack], gain 2 action points.

rulings.description:
You may only play Sand Sketched Plan in your deck if your hero is Rhinar, Reckless Rampage or Rhinar (young hero).
This checks the discarded card’s base power. Effects that modify a card's power are not applied to a card discarded from hand.
You may elect not to put a card into your hand, you still must discard and shuffle your deck after.
You can only pitch when there is a cost to pay. You cannot pitch a card to cast Sand Sketched Plan.
Sand Sketched Plan does not have go again. If you don’t discard a card with 6 or more power from its effect, your action phase will end unless you had two or more action points before playing Sand Sketched Plan.

cards.name: Savage Feast
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Savage Feast, discard a random card.

If the discarded card has 6 or more [attack], Savage Feast gains **go again**.

rulings.description:
When an action with go again resolves, its controller gains 1 action point.
Multiple instances of go again on the same card or activated ability do not stack. If a card or activated ability has multiple instances of go again when it resolves its controller gains 1 action point only.

cards.name: Savage Swing
cards.text: As an additional cost to play Savage Swing, discard a random card.
cards.flavour: "I should have listened - no amount of money is worth coming to this retched place."

cards.name: Scabskin Leathers
cards.text:
**Once per Turn Action** - 0: Roll a 6 sided die. Gain action points equal to half the number roll, rounded down.

**Battleworn** *(If you defend with Scabskin Leathers, put a -1[defense] counter on it when the combat chain closes.)*

rulings.description:
When you defend with a card it remains on the combat chain until the chain closes, therefore you cannot defend with an equipment multiple times on the same combat chain.
A [-1 defense] counter stays on the card until the card is destroyed or the game ends.
If the defense of a card that is defending is below zero, calculate as if its defense is zero.

If the number rolled is 1, no action points would be gained.
Scabskin Leathers requires an action point to use.

cards.name: Sink Below
cards.text: You may put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavour: Those blessed with Aether have an incredible gift - the power to shape the fabric of reality.

rulings.description:
Sink Below can only be played in the reaction window.
You must resolve Sink Below’s ability before deciding if you are defending with any additional cards in the reaction window.
You cannot use Sink Below’s ability if you have no other cards in your hand. You only draw a card if you put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck.
Sink Below’s effect is optional. You may still play Sink Below if you have no other cards in your hand.

cards.name: Skullhorn
cards.text:
**Action** - Destroy Skullhorn: Draw a card then discard a random card. **Go again**

**Arcane Barrier 2** *(If your hero would be dealt arcane damage, you may pay [2 resource] instead. If you do, prevent 2 arcane damage that source would deal.

cards.name: Smash Instinct
cards.text: **Intimidate** *(Target hero banishes face down a random card from their hand. At the beginning of the end phase, return all cards banished this way to their owner's hand.
cards.flavour: Following one's instinct may be ill advised.

rulings.description:
The player who owns the banished card may look at it.
The card banished from intimidate is returned to hand at the beginning of the end phase. This is before players draw up to hand size.
You may target yourself with this ability. However you will receive the card back into your hand before drawing up to your hand size.
You may target a hero with no cards in hand.
If there are other banished cards that aren’t from intimidate, it is encouraged to keep intimidated cards seperate from these cards.

cards.name: Springboard Somersault
cards.text: If Springboard Somersault is played from arsenal, it gains +2[defense].

cards.name: Swing Fist, Think Later
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Swing Fist, Think Later, discard a random card.

**Go again**
cards.flavour: "Nobody says that about my Mama." - Thuk

cards.name: Timesnap Potion
cards.text: **Action** - Destroy Timesnap Potion: Gain 2 action points.
cards.flavour: "...and only a slight chance of temporal dissociation!" - Lena-Belle

cards.name: Tome of Fyendal
cards.text:
Draw 2 cards.

If Tome of Fyendal is played from arsenal, gain 1[life] for each card in your hand.
cards.flavour: Even the simplest recollection of the Old Ones holds immense power...

rulings.description:
The green symbol of Tome of Fyendal is life.
You can exceed your starting life total. There is no maximum life total.
If you end the turn with more cards in hand than your hero’s intellect, you do not discard to your hero’s intellect (hand size). There is no maximum hand size

cards.name: Wrecker Romp
cards.text: As an additional cost to play Wrecker Romp, discard a random card.
cards.flavour: The savage rule of the jungle; only the strong survive.

cards.flavour: The savage rule of the jungle; only the strong survive.
